channel.title: Welcome Screen
channel.description:
Alright, this is quite strange. I was trying to delete my welcome screen so this is what i did. In client.java i searched for welcome screen and just say this is the welcome screen code:
blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah
Well i added // infront of it and compiled. it screwed it up so i took away the // and compiled. Now when I log in it flickers. Why would that be?

item.title: Welcome Screen
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

Loveandpower:

perhaps by doing this somehow rsframe has been corrupted? not sure couple of things could had caused this…

Alright thanks, ill have another look at it

Read full topic

item.title: Welcome Screen

item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

yes i know, but i took that all away, so its back to how it used to be, and it flickers now
but thanks anyway

item.title: Welcome Screen
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:1, topic:426512”]Alright, this is quite strange. I was trying to delete my welcome screen so this is what i did.
In client.java i searched for welcome screen and just say this is the welcome screen code:

blah blah
blah blah
blah blah
blah blah
blah blah
blah blah

Well i added // infront of it and compiled.
it screwed it up so i took away the // and compiled.
Now when I log in it flickers. Why would that be?[/quote]

Instead of doing this when commenting out multiple lines of code:

//blah blah
//blah blah
//blah blah
//blah blah
//blah blah
//blah blah

Do this:

/*blah blah
blah blah
blah blah
blah blah
blah blah
blah blah*/

That doesn’t help with your problem, but it will help you regardless.

Read full topic
